explanations.A: Area of triangle = ½ ✕ b ✕ h. The height referred to is the perpendicular height, which goes from the base to the top of the triangle. By drawing the line in and we have split the triangle into two equal right-angled triangles. Use Pythagoras’ Theorem to work out the missing length: 13² = a² ＋ 5². So 169 = a² ＋ 25, and this means a² = 144 and taking square roots on both sides: √(a²) = √144 So a, the perpendicular height = 12 cm. Substituting this into the area calculation: ½ ✕ 10 ✕ 12 = 60 square cm.
explanations.B: Keep going! You have worked out the perpendicular height of the triangle, now what is the area?
explanations.C: Not quite! Remember for area of a triangle we need the perpendicular height (imagine a stone being dropped from the apex (top) of the triangle). You have used the slant height here.
explanations.D: Keep going! I think you have forgotten the final step in calculating the area of a triangle, which is to divide by 2.
